Waste_Type: Résidus de la production d'alumine de l'usine des Aygalades - boues rouges déshydratées -
Description: Red mud is mostly made up of fine elements, clays and silts (the fraction <5µm is around 60%). The chemical analysis indicates the following average values: • Water content: between 40 and 46% • Iron oxide (in the form of clay particles): 45% (in % DM) • Sodium silico-aluminate (in the form of crystals cementing the iron oxide particles): 37% (in % DM) • Calcium titanate (in crystallized form): 10% (in % DM) These three compounds therefore represent 92% of the dry matter. Other constituents include complex compounds of Manganese, Phosphorus, Vanadium, Fluorine, Chromium, etc. (2,000,000 t)
Label: DSH

Description: Red mud is mainly composed of fine elements (clay and silt). The water content of this mud is between 40 and 46%. Chemical analyzes carried out by APAVE laboratories indicate that this mud is essentially composed of iron oxides Aluminum, Sodium, Silicon, Titanium, Calcium.
